title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheese, and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the pan with pancetta and toss.
Remove from heat and slowly add egg mixture, tossing quickly to coat.
Add pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into chunks
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, half the garam masala, cumin, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large pan and cook marinated chicken until browned. Set aside.
In the same pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add remaining spices and cook for 30 seconds.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Return chicken to pan and simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in cream and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Delicious and flavorful beef tacos topped with fresh salsa, lettuce, and cheese.
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add ground beef and cook, breaking it up, until browned.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Drain excess fat from the pan.
Add taco seasoning and water, simmer for 5 minutes.
Warm taco shells according to package instructions.
Fill each shell with beef mixture.
Top with lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, and sour cream.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with lime wedges.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: Crisp romaine lettuce tossed with Caesar dressing, croutons, and parmesan cheese.
instructions: Wash and dry romaine lettuce thoroughly, then chop into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic, and Worcestershire sauce.
If using anchovies, mash them and add to the dressing.
Add half the Parmesan cheese to the dressing and mix well.
Add lettuce to the bowl and toss to coat with dressing.
Top with remaining Parmesan cheese and croutons.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately for best texture.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic homemade chocolate chip cookies that are crispy on the outside and chewy inside.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream butter with both sugars until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla.
Gradually mix in the flour mixture until just combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes until golden brown around edges.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

title: Grilled Salmon
summary: Perfectly grilled salmon fillet with herbs and lemon, served with seasonal vegetables.
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Pat salmon fillets dry and brush with olive oil.
Season with salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
Grill salmon for 4-5 minutes per side, depending on thickness.
In the last 2 minutes, add lemon slices to the grill.
Meanwhile, steam asparagus until tender-crisp, about 4-5 minutes.
Toss asparagus with butter, salt, and pepper.
Serve salmon topped with grilled lemon slices and fresh herbs.
Arrange asparagus alongside the salmon on plates.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A healthy mix of fresh vegetables stir-fried in a savory sauce with garlic and ginger.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add harder vegetables first (broccoli, carrots) and cook for 2 minutes.
Add remaining vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat.
Cook for 1 more minute until sauce thickens slightly.
Remove from heat and garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve immediately over rice or noodles.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: Traditional Italian pizza with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil on a crispy crust.
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C). If using a pizza stone, place it in the oven.
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to desired thickness.
Transfer to a pizza pan dusted with cornmeal.
Brush dough with olive oil and minced garlic.
Spread pizza sauce evenly, leaving a 1-inch border for crust.
Arrange mozzarella slices and tomato slices on top.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves before serving.
